paper_title: Dye-Sensitized Fe-MOF nanosheets as Visible-Light driven photocatalyst for high efficient photocatalytic CO2 reduction

light source.context: Dye-sensitized system holds great potential for the development of visible-light-responsive photocatalysts not only because it can enhance the light absorption and charge separation efficiency of the systems but also because it can tune the band structure of catalysts.Herein, two-dimensional (2D) Fe-MOF nanosheets (Fe-MNS) with a LUMO potential of 0.11 V (vs.RHE) was prepared.Interestingly, it has been found that when the 2D Fe-MNS catalyst was functionalized with visible-light-responsive Ru(bpy) 3 2 as a dye-sensitizer, the electrons from the Ru(bpy) 3 2 can effectively inject into the 2D Fe-MNS, which resulted in a negative shift of the LUMO potential of the 2D Fe-MNS to A0.15 V (vs.RHE).Consequently, the Ru(bpy) 3 2 /Fe-MNS catalytic system exhibits a sound photocatalytic CO 2 -to-CO activity of 1120 lmol g -1 h A1 under visible-light-irradiation. The photocatalytic CO production was further ameliorated by regulating the electronic structure of the 2D Fe-MNS by doping Co ions, achieving a remarkable photocatalytic activity of 1637 lmol g -1 h A1 .This work further supports that the dyesensitized system is an auspicious strategy worth exploring with different catalysts for the development of visible-light-responsive photocatalytic systems.

light source.source: A 300-W Xe lamp (Solar edge 700, set at 100 mW cm A2 ) covered with a 420 nm cut-off filter was used as a light source.
light source.context: All the chemical reagents used in this manuscript were analytical grade and used as received without additional purification, and 18.2 MO deionized water was used for the preparation of the aqueous solutions.N, N-dimethylformamide (DMF, 99.8, Aladdin), ethanol (99.5, Aladdin), 1,4-terephthalic acid (H 2 BDC, 99, Aladdin), triethylamine (TEA, 99.5, Meryer), Fe(NO 3 ) 3 A9H 2 O (99, Aladdin), and Co(NO 3 ) 2 (99, Aladdin), were used as raw materials for the preparation of the 2D Fe-MNS and 2D Co-Fe-MNS samples.Na 2 SO 4 (98, Sigma-Aldrich) was used as an electrolyte precursor.Acetonitrile (greater than99, Aladdin), triethanolamine (TEOA, 98, Aladdin) were used as a solvent and sacrificial reagent, respectively.Ruthenium bipyridine (Ru(bpy) 3 2 , 95, Aladdin) was used as a dye-sensitizer. The 2D Fe-MNS was synthesized according to the previous report 30.Typically, 32 mL of N, N-dimethylformamide (DMF), 2 mL of ethanol, 2 mL of deionized water (DI), and 0.75 mmol of 1,4-terephthalic acid (H 2 BDC) were added in a 50 mL beaker.Then, the solution was fully dispersed by sonication.To the above dispersion solution, a 0.375 mmol of Fe(NO 3 ) 3 A9H 2 O was added.After stirring for 5 min, a 0.8 mL of triethylamine (TEA) was added and further stirred for an additional 10 min.Finally, a uniform colloidal suspension was collected by centrifugation at 8500 rpm and washed 3 times with ethanol and freeze-drying.The 2D Codoped Fe-MNS was prepared by following the same protocol as that of the synthesis of the 2D Fe-MNS except adding the desired amount of Co(NO 3 ) 2 together with Fe(NO 3 ) 3 A9H 2 O.As a comparison, 2D Co-MOF nanosheets (2D Co-MNS) were prepared using the same protocol as that of the 2D Fe-MNS, in which the Fe(NO 3 ) 3 -A9H 2 O as a Fe precursor was replaced by Co(NO 3 ) 2 as a Co precursor. Scanning electron microscope (SEM) was examined using Hitachi S-4800 SEM.Transmission electron microscopy (TEM) was studied on a JEOL 2010F TEM.X-ray diffraction measurements (XRD) were carried out at room temperature using a Philips X' Pert Pro X-ray diffractometer equipped with a Cu Ka radiation.UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectra (DRS) were recorded using an Agilent-Cary 5000 spectrometer equipped with an integrating sphere.Xray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) and valence band spectra were measured on an ESCA Lab MKII X-ray photoelectron spectrometer equipped with Al-Ka X-ray radiation.Steady-state photoluminescence (PL) spectra were recorded on a Hitachi H-4600 spectrometer equipped with a Xe lamp.Time-resolved PL decay spectra were recorded (FLS980, Edinburgh Instruments Ltd) with the time-correlated single-photon counting (TCSPC) mode. The working electrode was prepared by dip-coating method and 0.5 mol/L of Na 2 SO 4 solution (pH 6.8) was used as the electrolyte.Typically, 1 mg of the catalyst was dispersed into 0.5 mL of ethanol and 10 mL of Nafion solution to form a slurry.Then, the slurry was dip-coated on the clean FTO conductive glass with an exposure area of 1 cm 2 .Subsequently, the film was dried in a vacuum oven at 60 C.Mott-Schottky (MAS) plots, photocurrent, and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) measurements were performed on a CHI 660D electrochemical workstation (Shanghai Chenhua, China) with a three-electrode system using the sample-coated ITO glass as photoelectrode, Pt foil as a counter electrode, and Ag/AgCl electrode as reference electrode, respectively. The photocatalytic CO 2 reduction reaction experiments were studied in the Pyrex cell with a side irradiation window and equipped with the circulation water system.The temperature was controlled at room temperature (20 C).A 300-W Xe lamp (Solar edge 700, set at 100 mW cm A2 ) covered with a 420 nm cut-off filter was used as a light source.In a typical experiment, 5 mg of catalyst was suspended in a mixed solution of 5 mL of acetonitrile, 1 mL of triethanolamine (TEOA), and 20 mg of Ru (bpy) 3 . Before the photocatalytic reaction, the reaction cell was evacuated and refilled with high-purity CO 2 three times to remove O 2 and other possible gases.Then, the CO 2 -saturated solution was irradiated under visible light irradiation.The produced amount of gas was quantified by gas chromatography (GC7820A, Agilent).To test the stability of photocatalysts, four consecutive photoreaction runs (3 h each) were conducted using recycling catalysts, keeping other parameters constant.

light source.source: In summary, an efficient and stable visible-light-driven photocatalytic system over a dye-sensitized 2D Fe-MNS catalyst for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was demonstrated.
light source.context: In summary, an efficient and stable visible-light-driven photocatalytic system over a dye-sensitized 2D Fe-MNS catalyst for photocatalytic CO 2 reduction was demonstrated.In which, a visible-light responsive dye-sensitizer Ru(bpy) 3 2 was functionalized with the 2D Fe-MNS catalyst.The mechanism investigation of the Dye/Fe-MNS system indicates that during the photosensitizing processes the electrons from the Ru(bpy) 3 2 dye can be effectively injected into the 2D Fe-MNS, which resulted in the negative shift of the LUMO potential of the 2D Fe-MNS catalyst to fit for the theoretical thermodynamic reduction potential of CO 2 /CO.As a proof of concept, the Dye/Fe-MNS system exhibits a significant photocatalytic CO production rate of 1120 lmol g -1 h A1 under visible-light irradiation (k !420 nm).Furthermore, the photocatalytic activity of the 2D Fe-MNS was further ameliorated by regulating its electronic structure by Co-doping, achieving a remarkable photocatalytic CO production rate of 1637 lmol g -1 h A1 .This work provides a simple strategy for tuning the band structures of MOF-based photocatalysts and designing high efficient photocatalytic systems.
